flawed_nl_solution:
The hay previously cost $15 per bale so 10 bales would cost $15*10 = $<<15*10=105>>105
Double 10 bales is 10*2 = <<10*2=20>>20 bales
Better quality hay cost $18 per bale so 20 bales would cost $18*20 = $<<18*20=360>>360
Farmer Brown would need $360-$105 = $<<360-105=255>>255 more
#### 255

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 150, not 105. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
